newsitem.title: EGYPT: Eight Dutch tourists die in Egypt collision.
newsitem.headline: Eight Dutch tourists die in Egypt collision.

text.p: Eight Dutch tourists were killed in a head-on collision between a truck and a tourist bus in southern Egypt on Tuesday, the Interior Ministry said.

Giving another version of the accident, security sources in Aswan said an Egyptian also died, five Egyptians and 10 Dutch and Belgian tourists were hurt in the accident, which took place on the road that links the tourist towns of Aswan and Abu Simbel.
A Dutch embassy spokesman told Reuters the collision occurred 145 km (90 miles) south of Aswan. He said the embassy would send representatives to the town later on Tuesday.
Hundreds of tourists make the day trip between Aswan and Abu Simbel to visit the Great Temple of Ramses II.
Abu Simbel also has a smaller Temple of Hathor, which Ramses built in honour of his favourite wife, Queen Nefartari.

An international team of experts spent four years salvaging the temples by moving them stone by stone inside a specially built mountain up from Lake Nasser, which threatened to flood the monuments as it rose behind the newly built Aswan High Dam.
